title: Google-serp â€“ scrape Google search results with headless browser
author: self_refactor
content: readme.md google-serpscrape google search results using phobetor nightmare.js to it?// yarn add google-serpconst googleserp = require("google-serp")const serpresults = await googleserp({ query:"led zeppelin"})output:{ type:"result", payload:[ { url:"https://ledzeppelin.com", title: "homepage one rock blues legend", description:"led zeppelin is a misic will easily forget", position: 1 }, ... ]}typingtype serpresult = { url: string, title: string, description: string, position: number,}type result = { payload:array<serpresult> | error, type: "result" | "error"}googleserp({ query: string, showhundredflag?: boolean, show?: boolean,}): promise<result> there is error during scraping, library return object type equal "error" the error a payload. process is successful, library return object type equal "result" array results payload.argumentsquerygoogle search queryscrapehundredflag set true, will request 100 search result instead 10default value - falseshow set true, will show browserdefault value - falserequirementselectron compatible environment, .e. either system graphic interface you need use xvfb. the latter case need do something that https://gist.github.com/omarusman/1af968d9b96fc5b0cd39599db3f2b9bdchangelog0.1.7 fix error occuring there is element no description0.1.6 fix error exporting unexisting file v0.1.5
